content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #92178 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

this doesnt look like a regression, I can reproduce also on rust 1.56 and could not go further back (project requires edition=2021).
The reproducible in this comment goes back to 1.51, then I stopped testing

I would remove the I-prioritize.
As far as I'm aware, there's nothing saying that we shouldn't prioritize issues that aren't regressions?

I did a quick check of the working group procedure and our section in the compiler-team repo, and neither of them limit our role to regressions. Most often they just say issues, though sometimes they say bugs. I'm not sure we can meaningfully prioritize issues that aren't bugs though.

Still, I don't think that we should let the fact that we're only automatically called in for regressions stop us from triaging other things, unless there's another reason we shouldn't do that? Just looking at the relevant procedures though, which could be outdated, I think it's probably part of our role to prioritize any bug for which a prioritization has been requested.
If we were to prioritize this, I'd call it a P-medium.
agreed. I'll leave a p-medium on that issue anyway, it should frame it as "non critical" and won't hurt to show that someone weighed the issue a bit.
